Description.val:
The Next Generation Jammer (NGJ) is the next step in the evolution of Airborne Electronic Attack (AEA) and is a critical capability necessary to address current, emerging, and evolving Electronic Warfare gaps, ensure kill chain wholeness against growing threat capabilities and capacity, keep pace with enemy threat weapon systems' advancements, and support the continuous expansion of the AEA mission areas that exceed the capability of currently fielded systems. NGJ will utilize enhanced techniques and tactics to deliver significantly improved radar and communications jamming effectiveness as well as other classified capabilities.  Utilizing an Open Systems Architecture that supports software and hardware updates to rapidly counter emergent and evolving threats, NGJ is a key enabler and force multiplier for operations across the spectrum of missions defined in the Defense Strategic Guidance, including strike warfare, projecting power despite anti-access/area denial challenges, and counterinsurgency/irregular warfare.  NGJ will also address the shortfalls in scalability, flexibility, supportability, interoperability, availability, and capability of the existing AN/ALQ-99 Tactical Jamming System.

Beginning in FY 2020 NGJ-MB A-kit procurements are required to maintain alignment with H16 hardware procurement and installation, allowing for one major modification period for all advanced Growler installations in FY 2020 and FY 2021.  Performing these hardware installations simultaneously will provide cost and schedule efficiencies as aircraft are removed from service, run through major disassembly and reassembly only once, rather than multiple times.  The FY 2020 induction of these aircraft for modification allows for fleet integration, tactics development and initial cadre training in preparation for the first fleet operational capability.

Justification.val:
This is a FY 2020 new start. 

The Department of the Navy has been tasked with accomplishing the Nation's AEA mission in various theaters of operation over the last few decades. The AEA capability fielded by the Navy on the EA-18G Growler has been a high demand, low density asset. Stable investment in AEA systems will ensure continued availability of AEA capability to meet warfighter demand. NGJ will address AEA capability and sufficiency gaps against enemy threats operating in all frequency bands of the electromagnetic spectrum. NGJ will provide the ability to effectively engage enemy threats from increased stand-off distances, employ increased capacity (number of jamming assignments) against enemy targets, and support agile employment by operators. The NGJ system will be integrated on the EA-18G tactical aircraft and will augment and then replace the legacy AN/ALQ-99 Tactical Jamming System pods.

Name.@footnote: The Peculiar Support Equipment requirement for Operational/Intermediate/Depot-Level Support is determined from the Support Equipment/Operational Test Program Set requirement and corresponding quantities to support the Carrier Air Wing, Expeditionary, and Reserve squadrons. Phasing of support equipment is based on when squadron stand-up occurs to achieve the Navy Support Date of FY 2026.
Phasing of ILS is based on when squadron stand-up occurs to achieve the Navy Support Date of FY 2026.

The requirement for Operational/Intermediate/Depot-Level technical manuals is determined by the quantity of pages and the cost per page. Phasing of data is based on when squadron stand-up occurs to achieve the Navy Support Date of FY 2026.
Phasing of Training Equipment is based on IOC and first deployment.

Beginning in FY 2020 NGJ-MB A-kit (EA-18G modifications) procurements are required to maintain alignment with H16 hardware procurement and installation, allowing for one major modification period for all advanced Growler installations in FY 2020 and FY 2021. Performing these hardware installations simultaneously will provide cost and schedule efficiencies as aircraft are removed from service, allowing them to run through major disassembly and reassembly only once, rather than multiple times. The FY 2020 induction of these aircraft for modification allows for fleet integration, tactics development, and initial cadre training in preparation for the first fleet operational capability. On 3 December 2018, the NGJ-MB program received authorization from the Milestone Decision Authority to procure and install NGJ-MB A-Kits into the EA-18G Growler prior to the NGJ-MB Milestone C (4QFY20).

ImplementationMethodName.val: Contractor Field Mod Team:: Installation Name: NGJ Kits
NGJ Mid-Band Pod Shipset - Not Installed

Description.val:
The AN/ALQ-249 Next Generation Jammer - Mid Band (NGJ-MB) (formerly known as Next Generation Jammer Increment 1) program will address AEA capability and sufficiency gaps against enemy threats operating in the middle frequency bands of the electromagnetic spectrum. NGJ-MB will provide the ability to effectively engage enemy threats from increased stand-off distances, employ increased capacity (number of jamming assignments) against enemy targets, and support agile employment by operators. The NGJ-MB system will be integrated on the EA-18G tactical aircraft and will augment and then replace the legacy AN/ALQ-99 Tactical Jamming System Mid-Band pods. 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES

Beginning in FY 2020 NGJ-MB A-kit (EA-18G modifications) procurements are required to maintain alignment with H16 hardware procurement and installation, allowing for one major modification period for all advanced Growler installations in FY 2020 and FY 2021. Performing these hardware installations simultaneously will provide cost and schedule efficiencies as aircraft are removed from service, run through major disassembly and reassembly only once, rather than multiple times. The FY 2020 induction of these aircraft for modification allows for fleet integration, tactics development and initial cadre training in preparation for the first fleet operational capability supporting the master aviation plan.  Milestone C is scheduled for 4th Quarter FY 2020 with Initial Operational Capability scheduled for 4th Quarter FY 2022. 

FY 2020 NGJ-MB A-kit procurements and installs will be required before Milestone C.  On 3 December 2018, the NGJ-MB program received authorization from the Milestone Decision Authority to procure and install NGJ-MB A-Kits into the EA-18G Growler prior to the NGJ-MB Milestone C (4QFY20).
